subtitle: You may be anemic
title: Feel tired and weak?
content:
Created by BabyCenter


You need a lot of extra iron in your blood in pregnancy. The iron helps your baby grow so that he is not born too early and can be born healthy. Iron also helps to reduce the amount you bleed at the birth. You can get iron by eating food which contains iron. 

Without enough iron, your body will not get as much oxygen. This is called iron-deficiency anaemia. It will make you feel tired and weak.

Try to eat plenty of iron-rich foods every day. There are lots of iron-rich foods:

•	Kale, broccoli and other green leafy vegetables such as Swiss chard and spinach 

•	Eggs, poultry, fish, and meat 

To get enough iron, try to have a mixture of all these foods. 

Some health clinics will give you iron tablets. When you take them each day, have some fruit, or fruit juice. This will help your body take in more of the iron.

Try not to drink black tea or coffee with meals or when you take your tablets, as these drinks make it difficult for your body to get the  iron.

[Iron deficiency anemia in pregnancy][1]


  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/0_iron-deficiency-anemia-in-pregnancy_3073.bc
